reference.shortdesc: A topic head is a title-only entry in a DITA map.

keywords.indexterm: messages issued by processorstopichead with no navigation title

section.title: Processing expectations
section.p:
The content of the navtitle element should appear as a heading when the map is rendered as a table of content. In print contexts it should also appear as a heading in the rendered content.
The above content was in the DITA 1.3 short description. Should it be a normative statement?
Processors SHOULD generate a warning if a navigation title is not specified on a topichead element.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The topichead element is specialized from topicref. It is defined in the map-group module.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: , (except for locktitle), and copy-to from . This element also uses the scope, format, and type attributes from .
